articles.text: The dawn of Apple’s switch of macOS to run on Arm processors is finally almost here, at least if the leaks are correct, and I’m hoping it gives one misunderstood Mac product another chance to prove its merit. Rumored for years, it’s a blow to Intel and potent…

articles.title: Apple breaks up with Intel as chip supplier for Macs
articles.text: CNBC's Josh Lipton reports that Apple will no longer use Intel chips and will use its own, instead. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Steve Grasso and Karen Finerman.

articles.title: Report: Apple to Launch New Mac Trade-in Program at its Retail Stores
articles.text:
Apple is expected to launch a trade-in program for Mac at retail stores in the U.S. and Canada. Customers will be able to trade-in their Mac’s at the retail store and get credit for a new purchase.

articles.title: The Apple Watch Series 6 may arrive with an OLED display; no microLED display in sight
articles.text: Apple's recent investment of US$330 million in a Taiwanese microLED factory in Taiwan prompted rumours that an Apple Watch using this advanced display technology would be arriving later this year. This will not be the case, according to one leaker.

articles.text:
The Mac is finally joining the in-store trade-in program.

Apple is adding the Mac to its in-store trade-in program.
Customers will be able to trade in a Mac at one of its retail stores.
The program will launch in June 15th in the U.S.…

articles.title: ★ On Apple Announcing the ARM Mac Transition at WWDC This Month
articles.text: It’s uncanny how similar the explanation could be for the PowerPC-to-Intel transition: vastly superior performance-per-watt, and Apple has ideas for future Macs that they can’t build without that superior performance-per-watt.
